result.title: Constellation Brands to Report Third Quarter 2026 Financial Results on January 7, 2026 After Market Close and Host Conference Call on January 8, 2026 at 10:30 AM ET
result.text: ROCHESTER, N.Y., Dec. 04, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Constellation Brands, Inc. (NYSE: STZ), a leading beverage alcohol company, announced today it will report financial results for its third quarter ended November 30, 2025, on Wednesday, January 7, 2026, after the close of the U.S. markets by posting the earnings release and financial tables, as well as other supporting materials, on the company's investor relations website at ir.cbrands.com. A live conference call for analysts to discuss the company's financial results, operating performance, strategic business initiatives, and outlook for the future with President and Chief Executive Officer, Bill Newlands, and Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, Garth Hankinson, will be hosted at 10:30 a.m. ET on Thursday, January 8, 2026.

result.title: Constellation Brands: Near-Term Headwinds, But Valuation Attractive With Potential Recovery Likely In The Next Fiscal Year
result.text: Constellation Brands is facing softer demand, but trends are stabilizing, inventories are lean, and easier comparisons should help revenue performance improve through FY26 and recover in FY27. Strong execution around innovation, pricing flexibility, and shelf-space expansion is helping Constellation gain share despite macro pressures, positioning it well for growth when volumes rebound. Margins and earnings should recover as cost-saving programs ramp up, volume trends normalize, and valuation re-rates closer to historical levels, offering attractive upside for long-term investors.

result.title: Constellation Brands: I'm In With Buffett
result.text: Constellation Brands is a compelling long-term contrarian opportunity, supported by Warren Buffett's recent $2B investment via Berkshire Hathaway. This premium beer importer boasts high margins, strong cash flow, a sound balance sheet, and a resilient premium beer portfolio with pricing power and product innovation. Despite current industry headwinds and highly negative sentiment, STZ is undervalued, offering ~20% upside based on midpoint management guidance and compressed valuation multiples.

result.title: Constellation Brands: The Limits Of A Beer-Only Story
result.text: Constellation Brands (STZ) faces declining beer volumes, margin pressure, and challenging input costs, leading to a negative outlook for sales and earnings. STZ's Q2 results were better than feared, but both beer and wine segments showed year-over-year declines, with tariffs and divestitures further impacting performance. Despite aggressive share buybacks and a 3% dividend yield, STZ's earnings pressure and lack of growth limit upside, especially versus higher-yielding Treasuries.

result.title: Constellation Brands: Weak Financials For Now, Future Can Be Better
result.text: Constellation Brands underwhelmed investors yesterday with its disappointing Q2 FY26 results. The company reported a bigger YoY contraction in sales than that seen in Q1 FY26, and the non-GAAP operating profit contracted YoY too, even as the operating margin remains strong. Despite multiple downgrades to the earnings outlook, the stock's forward P/E looks low, but it can be explained by the company's weakening fundamentals.
